derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: said to be from Old Grog, the reputed nickname (because of his grogram cloak) of Admiral Vernon (1684–1757), who in 1740 first ordered diluted (instead of neat) rum to be served out to sailors

entry.tran: 格洛格酒（用朗姆酒、威士忌等加水勾兑）
entry.def: Grog is a drink made by mixing a strong spirit, such as rum or whisky, with water.
